title: 🤖Big AI day at Google Cloud Next 2025
content:
GOOGLE
Image source: Google
The Rundown:
Google
announced
a flurry of AI news at its Google Cloud Next 2025 event, including a new agentic coding platform, next-gen AI chips, upgrades to its video, audio, and image models, a new Gemini 2.5 Flash model, and more.
The details:
Google’s Project IDX is
merging
with Firebase Studio, turning it into an agentic app development platform to compete with rivals like Cursor and Replit.
The company also
launched
Ironwood, its most powerful AI chip ever, offering massive improvements in performance and efficiency over previous designs.
Model
upgrades
include editing and camera control in Veo 2, the release of Lyria for text-to-music, and improved image creation and editing in Imagen 3.
Google also
released
Gemini 2.5 Flash, a faster and cheaper version of its top model that enables customizable reasoning levels for cost optimization.
Why it matters:
This quick summary doesn’t do justice to the full breadth of announcements, with Google’s AI advances reaching across every aspect of the ecosystem. Between top models, advanced chips, and now its own competing IDE, Google continues to pack an absolutely massive punch with each new AI reveal.
rewrite:
# 🌐 GOOGLE's AI News Roundup! 💡
![Google Logo](Google)

## 💫 **The Rundown:**

Google recently made a splash at its _Google Cloud Next 2025_ event with a deluge of AI announcements, featuring everything from a new agentic coding platform to next-gen AI chips, and upgrades to its video, audio, and image models. They even launched the new Gemini 2.5 Flash model and more. 🚀

## 👀 **The details:**

Google's **Project IDX** is now joining forces with Firebase Studio 🤝, morphing into an agentic app development platform, set to rival competitors like Cursor and Replit.

The tech giant also unveiled **Ironwood** 🌳, its most potent AI chip to date, offering a massive leap in performance and efficiency over its predecessors.

Model upgrades are in full swing too! Editing and camera control in **Veo 2** 🎥, **Lyria** for text-to-music 🎼, and improved image creation and editing in **Imagen 3** 🎨.

Not to forget the release of **Gemini 2.5 Flash** ⚡, a faster and more affordable version of its top model, enabling customizable reasoning levels for cost optimization.

## 💡 **Why it matters:**

This brief summary can't cover the full scope of Google's announcements. With every new reveal, Google's AI advances

title: 🧩Solve the pricing puzzle for AI products
content:
TOGETHER WITH METRONOME
The Rundown:
Pricing an AI product right can often feel like solving a puzzle without the box cover. Join 49 Palms (ex-Simon Kucher, Author of Monetizing Innovation) and Metronome CEO Scott Woody to figure out how to build sustainable and effective pricing for AI.
In this session, you'll learn how to:
Apply a 9-step pricing framework
Monetize AI–whether it’s your core offering or an add-on
Treat pricing as a product and confidently run pricing experiments
Register now to save your spot
.
rewrite:
# 🤝 **TOGETHER WITH METRONOME** 🤝

Welcome to the enlightening session where you will be guided by experts from 49 Palms (ex-Simon Kucher, Author of Monetizing Innovation) and Metronome CEO Scott Woody! 🚀

Pricing an AI product can feel like solving a complex puzzle without seeing the complete picture. 🧩 But fear not, we're here to help you figure out how to build sustainable and effective pricing for AI products. 🛠️💰

In this session, you will:
- Grasp a 9-step pricing framework 📊
- Understand how to monetize AI–whether it’s your core offering or an add-on 🔍💵
- Learn to treat pricing as a product and confidently run pricing experiments 💡💼

Don't miss out on this opportunity to gain valuable insights! Register now to save your spot. 📝🎯

Make sure you're there! Let's solve the AI pricing puzzle together. 🧠💪

title: 🤝Google’s protocol for AI agent collaboration
content:
GOOGLE
Image source: …
The Rundown:
Google
launched
Agent2Agent, a new open protocol that enables AI agents from different developers and frameworks to communicate and collaborate, with backing from 50+ tech and service giants, including Salesforce, SAP, and PayPal.
The details:
A2A enables agents to discover capabilities, manage tasks cooperatively, and exchange info across platforms—even without sharing memory or context.
The protocol complements Anthropic's popular MCP, focusing on higher-level agent interactions while MCP handles interactions with external tools.
Launch partners include enterprise players like Atlassian, ServiceNow, and Workday, along with consulting firms like Accenture, Deloitte, and McKinsey.
The system also supports complex workflows like hiring, where multiple agents can do candidate sourcing and background checks without humans in the loop.
Why it matters:
AI agents are rapidly growing in capabilities, but unlocking their true capabilities will require a standard, streamlined way to interact with each other across platforms and frameworks. A2A could build on the success of MCP, helping build an interconnected system that allows multi-agent collaboration to tackle complex tasks.
rewrite:
# GOOGLE's Innovative Protocol: Agent2Agent 🚀

![Google](Image source)

In a groundbreaking move, Google has launched **Agent2Agent (A2A)**, a pioneering open protocol 🔄. This innovative protocol empowers AI agents developed by different creators and using diverse frameworks to interact and collaborate 💡. 

The initiative has gained support from over 50 tech and service giants, including Salesforce, SAP, and PayPal, among others 👏.

## About Agent2Agent

A2A fosters an environment where agents can discover capabilities, manage tasks cooperatively, and exchange information across platforms, even without sharing memory or context 🌐. 

It complements Anthropic's widely used MCP, focusing on high-level agent interactions while MCP takes care of interactions with external tools 🔧. 

## Partners on Board

Launch partners include enterprise players like Atlassian, ServiceNow, and Workday, as well as consulting firms Accenture, Deloitte, and McKinsey 🤝.

## Why It Matters

AI agents are quickly evolving, but realizing their full potential requires a standard, streamlined way for interaction across platforms and frameworks 🚀. A2A could capitalize on the success of MCP, contributing to the creation of an interconnected system that enables multi-agent collaboration for tackling complex tasks 💼.

title: 🎙️Build your first AI voice assistant with Vapi
content:
AI TRAINING
The Rundown:
In this tutorial, you will learn how to use Vapi to create AI-powered voice assistants that handle phone calls naturally, with customizable voices and integration capabilities.
Step-by-step:
Head over to
Vapi
and create an assistant by either scratch or selecting a starting template.
Select your preferred AI model that will power your conversations and your desired transcriber for accurate speech recognition.
Choose a voice from Vapi's library or create your own voice clone.
Finally, add tools and integrations that let your assistant take in-call actions, like checking calendars, scheduling appointments, or transferring to human agents when needed.
Pro tip:
Focus on optimizing response latency (to under 1.5 seconds) for a natural conversation flow. We just did an extensive workshop on building AI Voice agents at
The Rundown University
, led by Jordan Dearsley, the Founder & CEO at Vapi.
rewrite:
# 🤖 AI Training 🎓

## 📚 The Rundown
In this tutorial, you'll get the knack of utilizing Vapi to create AI-powered voice assistants 🗣️. These assistants have the ability to handle phone calls in a natural manner, complete with customizable voices and seamless integration capabilities.

## 📝 Step-by-step Guide
1. Start by visiting [Vapi](www.vapi.com) and create an assistant, either from scratch or by selecting a starting template. 
2. Choose your preferred AI model that will fuel your conversations🔥 and your desired transcriber for precise speech recognition👂. 
3. Pick a voice from Vapi's rich library or create your own unique voice clone👥. 
4. Lastly, add tools and integrations that let your assistant perform in-call actions, such as checking calendars🗓️, scheduling appointments⏰, or transferring to human agents when required👩‍💼.

## 💡 Pro Tip
Keep your focus on optimizing response latency (aiming for under 1.5 seconds) to maintain a smooth and natural conversation flow🌊. Remember, we have recently conducted an extensive workshop on building AI Voice agents at [The Rundown University 🎓](www.therundownuniversity.com). This was led by none other than Jordan Dearsley, the esteemed Founder & CEO at Vapi.

title: 🤖Samsung’s Gemini-powered Ballie home robot
content:
SAMSUNG & GOOGLE
Image source: Samsung
The Rundown:
Samsung and Google just
announced
a major partnership to launch Ballie—a soccer ball-sized home robot teased for years at Samsung’s CES events—with Gemini AI models under the hood.
The details:
Ballie can roam homes autonomously on wheels, project videos on walls, control smart devices, and handle tasks through voice commands.
The robot will combine Gemini models with Samsung's own AI, delivering multimodal capabilities for voice, audio, and visual inputs.
It will launch in the U.S. and South Korea this summer, with plans for third-party app support also in the pipeline.
Ballie, first revealed at Samsung’s CES event in 2020, has gone through several iterations over the years, but is only now getting an official release.
Why it matters:
The AI consumer robotics race is shaping up to be the next big tech frontier, and few are as well-positioned as Samsung to lead it—leveraging their expansive SmartThings ecosystem and, now, the power of Google’s Gemini models to deliver truly ‘smart’ home robots that could redefine the category.
rewrite:
# 🎉 Exciting News: SAMSUNG & GOOGLE Partnership 🎉

![Samsung and Google Partnership](Image source: Samsung)

## 📢 Major Announcement

Samsung and Google have just announced a major collaboration to launch Ballie, a soccer ball-sized home robot that has been teasing us for years at Samsung's CES events. This innovative robot is powered by Gemini AI models. 🤖

## 🔍 Closer Look at Ballie

Ballie has the ability to roam autonomously in homes on wheels, project videos on walls, control smart devices, and handle tasks via voice commands. It combines Gemini models with Samsung's own AI, providing multimodal capabilities for voice, audio, and visual inputs. 🗣️🎧👁️ 

Ballie is set to launch in the U.S. and South Korea this summer, with plans for third-party app support also in the pipeline. This home robot, first showcased at Samsung's CES event in 2020, has undergone several iterations over the years and is now ready for its official release. 🚀

## 🎯 Why This Matters

The AI consumer robotics race is shaping up to be the next big tech frontier. Samsung is well-positioned to lead this race with their expansive SmartThings ecosystem and the powerful Gemini models from Google. This could redefine the concept of 'smart' home robots. 🏡🤖
